org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports

Class CategAmountCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.Cell
      • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.CategAmountCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, DatedCell, CategCell, NumberedCell

    public final class CategAmountCell
extends Cell
implements CategCell, DatedCell, NumberedCell
    the most widely instantiated cell in NiReports - the one holding "funding" (e.g. regular hierarchies-abiding numerical cells). A CategAmountCell is an amount with a date (translatedDate) and a currency which has attached both coordinates and metadata. The coordinates obey the same contract as Cell.getCoordinates(), while the metadata is an opaque map from String to Object. NiReports Core ignores the metadata - it is up to the schema to populate and interpret it (probably via Behaviour subclasses or a BasicFiltersConverter subclass).
    You can notice that this class (and its enclosed instances of other classes) offer lots of data which is ignored by Core with the expectation that they would be useful for real-life usage (for example: MonetaryAmount.origAmount, MonetaryAmount.origCurrency) Because measure cells cannot be used as bases for a hierarchy, they universally have Cell.entityId = -1 and Cell.mainLevel is empty().
    This class is deeply immutable

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      MonetaryAmount amount
      the amount stored in this cell, plus some accessory information like the date of the transaction.

      the opaque metadata
      TranslatedDate translatedDate
